quotes.front: His life was great! He had just obtained his diploma, a position at the Bank had been arranged for him, he'd stopped fiddling with that stupid guitar, and thanks to yours truly he even had a rich marriage prospect---a bit ugly, but that's what mistresses are for.

foundation.q.title: The Desrosiers Foundation
foundation.q.summary:
Tragedy befalls Mr. Desrosiers: his son took his own life. How
    will he keep his colleagues' respect in spite of his failure as a
    parent?
foundation.q.author: Sophie Breuleux

quotes.front:
Up to this point Drumpf the Clown's life had been a perfect
crescendo of glory and success. He had found his place in the
universe, up there with the kings of kings. And then came the
morning's papers and the devastating news therein.

drumpf.q.title: Ambition of a Clown
drumpf.q.summary:
Outraged not to be the center of attention, Drumpf the Clown
    decides to seek the presidency of the United States of America.
drumpf.q.author: Olivier Breuleux

quotes.front:
I can't wait to see my creation washing over Rome like a typhoon,
leading his army of the risen dead with a cerberus made out of living
fire, mercilessly throwing Roman sinbags into the steaming acid of a
transmuted Tiber.
quotes.q1:
I
still haven't fixed the monthly leaking issue with women... but that
can wait.
quotes.q2:
I have always used violence as a means to my ends, and it
has always worked splendidly.

gospel.q.title: The Gospel According to God
gospel.q.summary:
God creates a killing machine, but His Plan does not work as
    He expected.
gospel.q.author: Olivier Breuleux

quotes.front: As the host---ripe for botox, but who cares, this is England---beckons him to the scene, Jean Joseph reflects that this opportunity could not have come at a better time. Indeed, his electric lawn mower broke down a mere month ago ...

deal.q.title: Deal or No Deal, Insipid Edition
deal.q.summary:
Jean Joseph Beaulieu, the most insipid man in the world, is given
    a golden opportunity: he has been chosen to participate in the
    famed game show, Deal or No Deal!
deal.q.author: Sophie & Olivier Breuleux

quotes.front:
I sit at the bar and I order a beer. The barman gives me an
empty glass and a five dollar bill.

mirror.q.title: The Wrong Side of the Mirror
mirror.q.summary:
As if his hangover wasn't enough, a man gets lost on the
    other side of the mirror.
mirror.q.author: Olivier Breuleux

quotes.front:
Intoxicating aromas waft around, searching for noses,
from the foods that scarlet demons bring diligently, coming out of
openings in the wall that close behind them ...

breakfast.q.title: Breakfast at Satan's
breakfast.q.summary:
Lobster omelettes, crepes and maple syrup, exotic fruits:
    what won't you eat?
breakfast.q.author: Olivier Breuleux

quotes.front: ... the universe conspires to make my every move into a deadly circumstance, as if every little thing I do sets into motion the dominoes of someone else's fate.

danger.q.title: I Am Dangerous
danger.q.summary: The most dangerous man in the world reflects on their curse.
danger.q.author: Olivier Breuleux

quotes.front:
I found a warm cup full of the revolting narcotic in the break
room, and took it to my least annoying colleague, Mr. Young. But he
was not there! How odd!

sick-leave.q.title: The Mystery of the Sick Leave
sick-leave.q.summary:
Anatole Lafeuille, an amateur detective who is as scornful as he
    is incompetent, investigates his colleague's absence at work.
sick-leave.q.author: Sophie Breuleux

quotes.front: None of this, however, applies to Jean Joseph Beaulieu, who has a rare talent: each impression he makes is equal to the first, and just as quickly forgotten. He is like a ghost. A really, really boring ghost.

insipid.q.title: The Insipid Man
insipid.q.summary:
Out of supplies for paint by numbers, the most boring man in the
    world has to find a new hobby.
insipid.q.author: Sophie Breuleux

quotes.front: Djvooooooommmmmmm! The Great Dyson's coming! He rolls up to us and waves with his long arm that ends with a hand dryer and no one says nothing.

dyson.q.title: The Great Dyson
dyson.q.summary:
In a world dominated by Dyson's sentient, omnipotent vacuum
    cleaners, a little boy zealously attends the weekly purge.
dyson.q.author: Sophie Breuleux

quotes.front:
But that idea was everything he had! His very identity as a
wheel maker had slipped through his fingers and the void was so great
that he felt he could never become whole again.

wheel.q.title: The Wheel Maker
wheel.q.summary: Grompf, proud inventor of the wheel, must reinvent himself.
wheel.q.author: Olivier Breuleux

quotes.front:
Who knows what I would see if I pulled them open?
The shockwave of an atomic mushroom, rolling toward me? Medusa's
petrifying stare? Or perhaps a hooded man with a gun pointed at
me... BLAM!

nightmare.q.title: Matryoshka Nights
nightmare.q.summary: A man desperately tries to tell his nightmares apart from reality.
nightmare.q.author: Olivier Breuleux
